title: Grade 4
subject: Alternative Content Standards - English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR GRADE 4: ENGLISH LANGUAGE ARTS

31E644F68CEB42EEB69C943F9DE543FB.description:
Add audio recordings
or visuals to a presentation about
a personally relevant topic.

71235E88032A4A8485CFDEB1A0DEF1B3.description:
The student can
choose a piece of information that
is related to a given topic in
preparation for a writing project.

5D5F9C8A3E0B49CDA914AED8CDE4E56F.description:
The student can
choose pieces of information that
are related to a given topic in
preparation for a writing project.

928134875C8741C5A0AA86B1A4146F39.description:
The student can sort
information into two categories in
preparation for a writing project.

8943B4BCEEED40F88BEF747B0022EDC1.description:
Recall and sort
information from personal
experiences or a topic into given
categories.

25D7265CAADA4ECEAEDC6458CD1F7264.description:
Gather information
about a topic from two or more
sources for a research project.

A8DA6284DC9649979768842A63322429.description:
With guidance and
support from adults, use
technology, including the
Internet, to produce writing while
interacting and collaborating with
others.

CD2046E23B8B4625ADB7352C6A6967A0.description:
The student can
select a word or phrase to describe
an event or personal experience
while preparing to communicate
about it.

145DBC9E113C496798AD8699B34D8F68.description:
The student can
identify or list two words that
describe an event or personal
experience while preparing to
communicate about it.

8CCE85388FB94412B6359C0897A42C50.description:
The student can
identify or list three words that
describe an event or personal
experience while preparing to
communicate about it.

66400F66A20C44A8982CF9B27E456BA1.description:
Write about events
or personal experiences

28FCAC23F5CE471692E209DB01EBC7A6.description:
The student can
identify and/or name familiar
people, places, professions, events,
and objects.

487F19D0BC16473A94C66C721D085919.description:
The student can
identify or select words that
describe familiar people, places,
things, professions, or events.

51E00064A23746228C7558755B14B37D.description:
The student can
identify or list words, facts, or
details that relate to a given topic.

AFCD7E5A500A47A599A6731B40E0E89B.description:
Write to share
information supported by details

BE0B9D7A89724F64BD22071E08F828E6.description:
The student can
select a labeled picture to identify
an opinion given by an author or
character about a given topic or
text.

BFE6A3285AEB4C45B83F73CB0E0DBB31.description:
The student can
identify an opinion about a topic or
short text. (The opinion may belong
to the student, writer or a
character).

A5A2A277659C4EED8DBB2396045B5A53.description:
The student can
identify or list reasons to support
an opinion about a given topic or
text. (The opinion may belong to
the student or the writer of a given
text.)

775DCA240552477FA802A58A45211AC5.description:
Write opinions
about topics or text

55125BB415274960840FABEE6FB1D75C.description: Students can investigate topics and present information.

7960CBD8A8FD48F9833BCF49463BB9AF.description:
Use words acquired
through conversations, being
read to, and during shared
reading activities including
domain specific words.

4AF1D6DB20554171AE1DB77661007356.description:
The student can identify
the correct use of language to
communicate effectively with
familiar people (e.g., sharing
information, responding to
greetings, being polite and making
simple requests, etc.).

1CFDA80BF0E74B78A980B66E4C31E6D3.description:
The student can use
language to communicate
effectively with a variety of
audiences and for different
purposes (e.g., asking questions,
sharing information, responding to
greetings, using polite expressions).

3A9E11B284454010B1EFCA229A071B65.description:
The student can use
language to express emotions and
communicate effectively with peers
and adults (e.g., asking and
answering questions, initiating
conversations, sharing information,
and making simple requests).

F61C5622B1664E5F8C29FB5DE0B5940A.description:
Use language to achieve
desired outcomes when
communicating.

B1CC8AEA55CF45018CDBD658C64CAEF9.description:
The student can identify
correct usage of simple
grammatical structures (e.g.,
singular/plural nouns) when
communicating.

35D800CA391E43E7BAB8E00BE5DF494E.description:
The student can
identify correct usage of simple
grammatical structures (e.g.,
singular/plural nouns, appropriate
pronouns) when communicating.

F12F332CDBE14BB6A27E59297A3957FC.description:
The student can
identify correct usage of
grammatical structures (e.g.,
singular/plural nouns, appropriate
pronouns, present/past tense
verbs) when communicating.

279D291B52A7427A9F0E2DBF1A61CE54.description:
Demonstrate Standard
English grammar and usage when
communicating.

A28F0400CB5B48CE90F1E77349515E02.description:
Differentiate between
communication partners and
contexts that call for formal and
informal communication.

CB95E52835F140788B6979612DF5D78C.description:
Retell a story or
personal experience or recount a
topic with supporting details.

1CD4C3C0F92845C49A4EDE0DBE4A0DA0.description:
Identify a point that
the speaker makes.

E0DCC7C26F5B496CA7E29573C19433DE.description:
The student can select a
detail from information presented
orally or through other media.

72E8DA9D9F94464F970AE0DD2DFC35B1.description:
The student can
answer basic questions about
details presented orally or
through other media.

05973A006A5344CEA5258D3B592EDB20.description:
The student can
answer questions about
information presented orally or
through other media, including (but
not limited to) points made by the
presenter.

79B156A35B2744A198D8EF32323E34CC.description:
Ask and answer
questions about details from a
text read aloud or information
presented orally or through other
media.

EF2F4762597445228359174F68C68078.description: Students can communicate for a range of purposes and audiences.

A98AEE8E6F4F4453A7EB21CEDEBD611F.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of conventions of
Standard English

6104748CAFCC407DA5DC23E01E844E96.description:
The student can
differentiate if a sentence is a
statement or a question.

691C2EAE47EB46DCAA7A3C1AE014A92F.description:
The student can
identify capital letters and basic
punctuation (periods and question
marks).

CC73B192664042D197189075E02C9384.description:
The student can
identify which word/words should
be capitalized in a sentence (first
words and proper nouns) and
choose the correct ending
punctuation (period, question
mark, or exclamation point).

1F0A769242CA4A28AC652E2958E15E72.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of conventions of
Standard English

81419E645C184E8481E1C33B2DC03D76.description:
Write routinely for a
variety of tasks, purposes and
audiences.

3F45977F56F54AECB363A73B4BDF4434.description:
Recall information
from literary and informational
text to support writing.

145AD723E3A344C3AA685F022F246531.description:
With guidance and
support from adults and peers,
plan before writing and revise
own writing.

E0FA474AE4F34CF3BA80AED84E5E7051.description:
The student can
contribute an idea during a
brainstorming session while
preparing for a writing assignment.

B38B5B3C324D4A08AE1DEE83CF2D880F.description:
The student can
contribute ideas during a
brainstorming session while
preparing for a writing assignment.

C0906E2849E740F7B50B7EA270AB2E35.description:
The student can use
ideas, details, or examples when
writing/dictating/drawing about a
given topic.

C272739A1DBB47A79B6A809B19DAA0ED.description:
Produce writing that
expresses more than one idea.

BD3340F6E3784CDAA7F12B88A38C1052.description:
The student can
indicate when something
happened (before or after) while
preparing to write/communicate
about an event or personal
experience.

6589D13B555F4E64A4CABCEA6FC56859.description:
The student can
order two details/events while
preparing to write/communicate
about an event or personal
experience.

7160DC39412247CF86366BCA4D308253.description:
The student can
write/dictate/draw about an event
or personal experience, using two
details/events in sequence.

6B17485BBA7D4A1DAB6C8607047EEF15.description:
Write about events
or personal experiences: Write
about a personal experience
including two events in sequence.

6A25DB0AFAE841DFA6B8451D5D20E33E.description:
Write to share
information supported by details

DB40D9A077AD4BD48B8F98C9B23AF8AA.description:
The student can
select a word or labeled picture
that expresses an opinion about a
given topic or text.

549EC2365E614EB7A4AD654A29EAC66E.description:
The student can
write or dictate an opinion about a
given topic or text.

133F908BC47D46A98B6EB2E0703BBB97.description:
The student can
write/dictate/draw a brief piece
describing his/her opinion on a
given topic or text.

419BACBD846B432B8DFD3A4DCA4BB338.description:
Write opinions
about topics or text

95CE521897554FD6AC2BE9E39C3A4CA5.description: Students can produce writing for a range of purposes and audiences.

6111AE559149483897F588F384717896.description:
The student can
identify the opposite meaning of
frequently used words.

51833C35D97340F8A37DCB2B6D787FC5.description:
The student can
identify the opposite meaning of a
given word that appears in a text.

529D24D815434E71AFD50C3063766E0A.description:
The student can
identify the meaning of words in
narrative and informational texts,
including (but not limited to)
opposites.

F94A503D19394D8CA614427916A6B239.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of word
relationships and use

364808AE179848D49ED57F72E3B5933D.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of word
relationships and use

16F61ACEFAEF4AF3BEBBF0206B2C7807.description:
The student can use
cues to recognize the meaning of
familiar words.

ECF1C7A404E74DC9B675F4A0E182407F.description:
The student can use
context cues to determine the
meaning of familiar words paired
with pictures and/or objects.

047E35482C38468E934D4DBE8D002DB8.description:
The student can use
context as a clue to guide selection
of a word or words that completes
a sentence.

60EE063852F04AFC86528452A143E264.description:
Use letter-sound
knowledge to read words.

B7D63C5199B5472BA2553E2E71B77945.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of text while
actively engaged in shared
reading of history/social studies,
science, and technical texts.

E20CD0198EAD497CA82007F1072A0FD8.description:
Compare details
presented in two texts on the
same topic.

DED957EF258D44FDB59538F97027016C.description:
Identify one or more
reasons supporting a specific
point in an informational text.

8DA9795E6EE44502857868C7773BB4E6.description:
The student can
identify/use simple visuals (such as
charts or illustrations) that go with
a particular informational passage.

568DC98B7E3C4185B2F72594708F2C4E.description:
The student can use
visual representations (pictures,
charts, diagrams, posters, recipes,
calendars, etc.) to find information.

7A6367EC36B14A75AC1199ADC4FBFC28.description:
The student can use
information presented visually
and/or orally (charts, graphs,
diagrams, timelines, photographs,
illustrations, posters, recipes, etc.)
to answer questions.

577479BCDDCD430B967FE04DE3053373.description:
Answer questions
about information presented
visually, orally, or quantitatively.

5F58864A710145FB9E1CF796976029BD.description:
Compare own
experience with a written
account of the experience.

0740668264044B5FB1E952E46BDE53F6.description:
The student can
identify the title of a passage.

80B0BCFC84FB426E9E78BF977C754590.description:
The student can
identify the title, headings, or
illustrations contained within an
informational text.

BBB75BEDDF334F938E451899CACBBBAB.description:
The student can
identify elements of informational
text (e.g., titles, headings,
subheadings, bulleted lists,
numbered stems, bold or italicized
text, pictures, tables, illustrations,
chronology of events, based on
fact, cause/effect, etc.).

1F09527D60254D3CA84190E21AA8F91D.description:
Identify elements that
are characteristic of informational
texts.

B271A917829A43B5B8C952F08277E0F9.description:
Determine meaning of
words in text.

A41EDCB99FC648A8A38B7EDA03A7773C.description:
Identify an explicit
detail that is related to an
individual, event, or idea in a
historical, scientific, or technical
text.

9603C0D3E58C42E7A45833E4D842CCB9.description:
The student can
identify the topic of a one- to two-sentence informational text.

2B7BC08BC5054597BC89AF94ABCF396E.description:
The student can
identify the main idea of a one-paragraph informational text when
it is explicitly stated.

4636999ED1ED4A0F82D6B895AD37675E.description:
The student can
identify the main idea of a multi-paragraph informational text when
it is explicitly stated.

5EB1F2CF3F114A539C424D67EE2825FF.description:
Identify the main idea
of a text when it is explicitly
stated.

5F8D3967827B427A90C04068AD085831.description:
The student can
answer simple who, what, where,
or when questions about short
informational texts.

A73D57634ED544648A48AEF1B5E6F336.description:
The student can
identify basic details (e.g.,
individuals, locations, events, and
text features) in a one-paragraph
informational text.

66E864D4294C4AC3BE113B8E328E233D.description:
The student can
answer questions about details
(e.g., individuals, events, locations,
and text features) in informational
text.

30410CBF4E2A420AA17481115282E4E2.description:
Identify explicit details
in an informational text.

75B9D20F76634DBB9835D26BB9B2A9E9.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of text while
actively engaging in shared
reading of stories, dramas, and
poetry.

6957EEF9AF1741978200FD82FE19690F.description:
The student can
identify what is the same (e.g.,
between two characters, or
between two settings).

661972A143B848038D8EE24A818D8CDC.description:
The student can
identify what is the same between
two characters, two settings, or
two events within a paragraph of a
narrative text.

F345876C2C39459E8E27943789A9B606.description:
The student can
identify what is similar between
two characters, two settings, or
two events in a narrative text.

CD49CBA2B6704059B40CB6D6F6367ABC.description:
Compare characters,
settings or events in stories,
myths or texts from different
cultures.

A4F90F2313A44464BA3F952BDD4B531B.description:
Make connections
between the text representation
of a story and a visual, tactual, or
oral version of a story.

DE0B72814C8A43DAB4F165AD33A46C92.description:
The student can
identify the speaker in a one- to
two-sentence narrative text with
dialogue.

E2BCBBA6AE664172870B0C6C551F7386.description:
The student can
identify who is telling a story when
given choices.

5A68A20F80214521AC01427E514CCDA1.description:
The student can
identify the narrator of a story.

8A767A557F51403DAB5CCB43462297B9.description: Identify the narrator of a story.

42FC194A7EDB45A2B55B000433812342.description:
The student can
differentiate between two types of
narrative text genre (e.g., stories,
poetry, songs).

D8EAEC958DCB4636B7AC632B444FFF1A.description:
The student can
identify simple story elements in
narrative text (e.g., characters,
setting, story sequence).

0BD45F0AC5C048EDA106FED111BFEA94.description:
The student can
identify the elements that comprise
stories (e.g., characters, settings,
plots, themes, point of view, etc.).

D3E07F19287D45AD98DCD337F0CC5B26.description:
Identify elements that
are characteristic of stories.

93F9BDE495654720AC5415AD887E3FDD.description:
Determine the
meaning of words in a text.

78AB7D50B396477AA83FADE9BF0CF44A.description:
Use details from the
text to describe characters in the
story.

FCE52EEED60E489F86791AEB8F6501BB.description:
The student can
identify the main idea of a one- to
two-sentence narrative text.

BDDF2D81F79B4AF3BA52A1F6F36E4D75.description:
The student can
identify the main idea of a one-paragraph narrative text.

D1195D17645446888EE83E297F30C4F5.description:
The student can
identify the theme or main idea of
a multi-paragraph narrative text.

D4EDCD04018B46F0BA4F30383C918A69.description:
Identify the theme or
central idea of a familiar story,
drama or poem.

EEA284F873424E83A6327EDC457B482B.description:
The student can
answer simple who, what, where or
when questions about narrative
text.

A34A9A5011814412889BE6BC85886549.description:
The student can
answer questions about basic
elements in a narrative text (e.g.,
characters’ names, settings, and
specific events).

423C6EE4EEDC480295286BD3E376187B.description:
The student can use
details to answer questions about
narrative text (characters, setting,
plot, sequence, etc.).

5D6C34637AB94C4881A8DF969F5E322D.description:
Use details from the
text to recount what the text
says.

2F8726C02ABD4D04B5201337CB493F1E.description: Students can comprehend text in increasingly complex ways.
